Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First I need to look at each case and see where the same activity names repeat The activities that seem to repeat are Verify Documents Call Customer and Adjust Account

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Starting with Case C001 The first Verify Documents is done by a BackOfficeAgent right after the request is initiated The context mentions checking identity documents Then later after the customer submits additional documents there is another Verify Documents again by BackOfficeAgent to recheck So the first could be initial verification and the second a reverification

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For Call Customer in C001 there is only one instance where the agent calls the customer to ask for missing documents But in other cases there might be multiple calls Wait in C002 there are two calls one to clarify a discrepancy and another followup So Call Customer needs to be distinguished based on purpose

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Next looking at Case C002 Verify Documents is first for identity then Adjust Account and another Call Customer The second call here is a followup The Adjust Account here is part of correcting an account issue after the call

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: In Case C003 Verify Documents happens twice The first is physical verification at the branch then after an account adjustment they verify again The Call Customer here is to have the customer return because they stepped out

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: So the main repeating activities needing renaming are Verify Documents Call Customer and Adjust Account

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For Verify Documents Initial verification vs reverification Maybe Initial Document Verification and ReVerification of Documents But in C003 the second verification is after an adjustment so maybe FollowUp Document Verification

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Call Customer instances have different reasons In C001 it is to request missing docs In C002 first call is to clarify a discrepancy second is followup In C003 the call is to get the customer back So perhaps Request Missing Documents Call Clarify Discrepancy Call FollowUp Confirmation Call and Customer Recall Call But maybe a better approach is to use the purpose Call to Request Missing Documents Call for Clarification FollowUp Call etc

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Adjust Account appears once in each case except maybe Lets check C001 Doesnt have Adjust Account except in C002 and C003 In C002 it is to adjust account details after a call In C003 the adjustment is due to missing info So maybe Adjust Account Details and Correct Account Information

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Wait but the task is to rename the activities so that within the same case their names are unique based on context Lets go case by case

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Looking at C001 Verify Documents occurs twice The first is at the beginning initial verification the second after the customer submitted more docs reverification So maybe Initial Document Verification and ReVerification of Documents

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: C002 Verify Documents once then Adjust Account then two Call Customer instances The first call is to clarify a discrepancy the second is a followup So the calls could be Call to Clarify Discrepancy and FollowUp Confirmation Call

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: C003 Verify Documents twice The first is physical verification since its a walkin the second after adjustment Maybe Physical Document Verification and PostAdjustment Document Verification The Call Customer here is to recall the customer so Call to Recall Customer

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait but the original log Adjust Account in C002 additional context is Adjust account details internally after call and in C003 it is Internal correction due to missing info So maybe Adjust Account Details vs Correct Account Information Now for each activity that repeats in a case rename them uniquely Also check for other activities Submit Additional is only once so okay Initiate Request and Approve Request are unique per case

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Let me list all the duplicates Activities to rename 1 Verify Documents in C001 occurs twice so need two names 2 Verify Documents in C003 occurs twice so two names 3 Call Customer in C002 occurs twice so two names 4 Call Customer in C003 occurs once but in C001 and C003 but in C003 its a different reason Wait C001 has one call C002 has two C003 has one So only in C002 Call Customer is duplicated But the problem requires renaming activities that appear multiple times within the same case so only within each case Therefore in C002 the two Call Customer instances need different names Similarly in C001 and C003 Verify Documents is duplicated in their respective cases

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now Adjust Account appears only once per case so no renaming needed there

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: So the renamed activities would be For C001 The two Verify Documents become Initial and ReVerification For C002 The two Calls become Clarify Discrepancy and FollowUp For C003 The two Verifies become Physical and PostAdjustment

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Also check if Adjust Account in different cases have different meanings For example in C002 its adjust account details internally after call and in C003 its internal correction due to missing info These might be different enough to rename but since they are in different cases the task says to focus on same case duplicates Since within each case Adjust Account only occurs once so no need to rename them across cases
